title: Goldman profits halved as cash set aside for lawsuits
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Goldman profits halved as cash set aside for lawsuits Goldman Sachs could face a federal lawsuit over its sales of residential mortgage-backed securities Lucas Jackson/Reuters Alexandra Frean US Business Editor Published 1 minute ago 
Goldman Sachs reported a massive slide in its second-quarter profit after it set aside $1.45 billion for litigation expenses. 
Shares fell by 1.3 per cent after the Wall Street bank said that net earnings for the three months to the end of June dropped sharply to $1.05 billion from $2.04 billion for the same period last year. 
Net revenue dipped by 1 per cent to $9.1 billion against the same time a year ago, but beat expectations. 
Goldman Sachs warned in February that it could face a federal lawsuit over its sales of residential mortgage-backed securities (RMBS).
